body_html:
@George35mk Sorry, I thought you were still having problems with OpKernel errors as I skimmed through your last code and this issue topic was about and missed you were later referring to a different situation (optimization warnings).

These are not errors but just warnings saying TF can be faster in your machine if you build it from source. It is all working as expected now.

This messages will show every first time you run a TF program if you don't set TF_CPP_MIN_LOG_LEVEL and will disappear afterwards.
Setting TF_CPP_MIN_LOG_LEVEL to 2 is a proper way to silence these WARNING logs (rather 3).

These are not errors but just warnings saying TF can be faster in your machine if you build it from source. It is all working as expected now.
This messages will show every first time you run a TF program if you don't set TF_CPP_MIN_LOG_LEVEL and will disappear afterwards.
Setting TF_CPP_MIN_LOG_LEVEL to 2 is a proper way to silence these WARNING logs (rather 3).
body:
@George35mk Sorry, I thought you were still having problems with `OpKernel` errors as I skimmed through your last code and this issue topic was about and missed you were later referring to a different situation (optimization warnings). 

These are not errors but just warnings saying TF can be faster in your machine if you build it from source. It is all working as expected now. 

This messages will show every first time you run a TF program if you don't set `TF_CPP_MIN_LOG_LEVEL` and will disappear afterwards.
Setting `TF_CPP_MIN_LOG_LEVEL` to 2 is a proper way to silence these WARNING logs (rather 3).
